statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Saint Louis 79, Quincy 55
article.story: ST. LOUIS (AP) -- Luke Meyer had 20 points and Tommie Liddell pulled down a career-best 17 rebounds to lead Saint Louis to a 79-55 victory over Quincy in the Billikins' season-opener. Saint Louis (1-0) had five players in double figures, despite shooting below 50 percent from the floor. Ian Vouyoukas, a preseason Atlantic 10 first-team selection, added 14, Kevin Lisch had 11, and Dwayne Polk and Danny Brown each added 10. Division II Quincy was led by Andre Muse with 20 points. A rugged start to the second half by the Billikens gave the Hawks an opening they failed to capitalize on. Saint Louis didn't sink a field-goal until the 16:43 mark and put Quincy in the bonus just seven minutes into the half after the Billikens drew their seventh foul with 13 minutes left. The Hawks chipped just six points off the 17-point halftime deficit. The Billikens jumped out to a 9-2 lead in the first 3:25 and sprinkled in small runs throughout the first half. The Hawks closed to within 12-8, but never got any closer as Saint Louis pulled out to a 45-28 lead at the break. Though a regular-season game for the Billikens, it counted as the final exhibition for the Hawks.
